title: here's an easy way to fix runeglaive on laners
body:
step 1: take runeglaive and throw it in the garbage
step 2: replace it with something junglers actually want

replies.body: can we replace it with something laners want? if not then im out
Just buff {{item:3100}} so it converts physical damage to magic damage like runeglaive
{{champion:112}} making Lich Bane into Runeglaive before Runeglaive was a thing
He's an inventor afterall.

Sorry but, a number of jungles enjoy runeglaive.
the only one I know of that got screwed was fiddlesticks

The only ap jungler who likes ruinglaive is diana, and even then just giving magus some mana sustain would have been a better choice since lichbane beats out ruinglaive for damage.

Fiddle got completeyl fucked.
Eve is better built ad.
Elise doesn't matter what she builds she's still trash tier. And as a stun bot the cdr from magus was helpfull.
Zac builds tank.
Choath builds tank.
Gragas builds tank.
Nunu builds tank.
You get the picture.
I mean obviously you know balance, throwing mana sustain on an item with 80AP and 20% CDR isn't the least bit overpowered.

> [{quoted}](name=Silents429,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=q8BsGNnz,comment-id=000200020001,timestamp=2015-07-03T19:51:39.879+0000)
>
> I mean obviously you know balance, throwing mana sustain on an item with 80AP and 20% CDR isn't the least bit overpowered.

because runeglaive turned out SO well?

On the few meta AP junglers and that weren't trying to be helped by runeglaive as much, not too much.

On a lot of other AP champions that aren't meta AP junglers and that Runeglaive was trying to help it's completely insane.

Just no one is trying out those non-meta AP champions and complaining too much about how "bad" runeglaive is that they aren't seeing why it's good or bad.
Runeglaive jg zyra has had some success for me; once you get trailblazer you just blaze a trail through the jungle easily.
{{item:3165}} I wonder what that might look like...
Would you fuck off with this damn spear

-Glances at morellonomicon- Yep

Edit: Someone already pointed this out.
> [{quoted}](name=SoMNia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=q8BsGNnz,comment-id=0002000200010001,timestamp=2015-07-03T21:45:38.064+0000)
>
> {{item:3165}} I wonder what that might look like...

So you name like one champion that actually got screwed by runeglave? Kek. (On Eve, it's at least as strong as Warrior because of mana and her E).

The thing is, of course, that AP junglers are terrible by definition. Mages need to scale, so why not just play them in the solo lanes? It's a last ditch effort to make up for a bad laning phase.
Even then, 9 out of 10 times, your team would rather have someone with Locket/FH/Randuin's than another mage on their team.

> [{quoted}](name=Dengeden,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=q8BsGNnz,comment-id=000200020008,timestamp=2015-07-04T08:33:53.528+0000)
>
> Even then, 9 out of 10 times, your team would rather have someone with Locket/FH/Randuin's than another mage on their team.

I think this may be the big issue.  A jungler, almost by definition, is going to be behind in gold and probably exp compared to laners.  Tanks have an easier time being useful while behind than most mages.

You can't come out of the jungle and deal tons of damage (in fair matches, or in other words, unless you're a pubstomping smurf).  There isn't enough farm and Riot won't allow a hard farm till you hard carry play pattern for junglers.  So you either bring utility and tankiness, or just utility, or nothing.
I don't find that true at all.  an underfarmed tank is not able to take hits at all.  there are also several popular assassin jungles, like pantheon and rengar.

I hate to blatantly contradict you but yes they can. Unless said tank got completely denied by the enemy jungler, they'll take a few shots. Tank items are a lot more efficient on their own than damage items are (that's why resistance penetration is a thing). If all else fails tanks can just dish out their CC, obligatory %health damage and peace out.

Thing about pantheon and rengar is simply that while they can use double buffs quite effectively.

With exactly what you just said, you pretty much just said all those champs got Cinderhulk instead of Magus to begin with and an AP item at all wouldn't change that.. lol.

Eve has the OPTION to go AP now since it turns her E into magic, which was the whole reason she couldn't go AP prior. 

Nidalee loves this item as it gives her more burst and when she rushes a big AP second, she has even MORE burst.

Diana loves it because it's a cheaper Lichbane with CDR on it, which is a lot more useful than 80 AP and 20% CDR. Hell, a lot of Dianas were going Devourer because it was more useful than Magus, lol.

And before you, or anyone else, goes 'Oh, well Lichbane is still better, so this item is garbage.' Most AP jungles switched out their Magus for something far more useful later one to begin with. Magus was a piece of crap and buffing it would've made AP junglers too strong because it's 2250g and huge AP on a 2250 item is TOO scary, especially since they're nerfing Zhonya's and Luden's to 100 while buffing others to 80 finally, yet still making them more expensive to compensate for more AP. This item is GOOD and with the buffs coming up, it will CONTINUE to be good while making the AP Ez's a little less common since it won't proc Luden's.

You guys all need to take a chill pill and realize how garbage Magus was to begin with. Only one who actually took a nerf was Fiddledicks. Nid, Diana, and Fizz are all VERY happy with this new item. lol. It's actually helped make Fizz be able to jungle to begin with.
Fizz. Fizz loves runeglaive. Nid has her early game buffed, but late game nerfed with it. Nidalee was better off with Magus, but Fizz for sure.
I find that with nid, it allows her to get her RoA/Abyssals earlier since she doesnt need to get Lichbane untill last if ever.

> [{quoted}](name=MT Skjar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=q8BsGNnz,comment-id=000200020002,timestamp=2015-07-03T20:52:30.274+0000)
>
> Fizz. Fizz loves runeglaive. Nid has her early game buffed, but late game nerfed with it. Nidalee was better off with Magus, but Fizz for sure.

Why DF would I build Runeglaive on Fizz when I can get more damage as a AP assassin with Lich Bane

> [{quoted}](name=MT Skjar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=q8BsGNnz,comment-id=000200020002,timestamp=2015-07-03T20:52:30.274+0000)
>
> Fizz. Fizz loves runeglaive. Nid has her early game buffed, but late game nerfed with it. Nidalee was better off with Magus, but Fizz for sure.

Fizz eeeh,  in the jungler i prefer devourer on hit fizz. Sure it might help ap fizz's clear time but purple smite did that anyway, and its still not worth the trade off for lower ratios on an assassin.

Nidalee's clear times were already good, she doesnt need help with that, and her early game is in no way buffed because ruinglaive and sheen both need ap to back them up before they reach a decent power level.

> [{quoted}](name=Saminus Maximus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=q8BsGNnz,comment-id=00020002,timestamp=2015-07-03T19:11:11.649+0000)
>
> The only ap jungler who likes ruinglaive is diana, and even then just giving magus some mana sustain would have been a better choice since lichbane beats out ruinglaive for damage.
> 
> Fiddle got completeyl fucked.
> Eve is better built ad.
> Elise doesn't matter what she builds she's still trash tier. And as a stun bot the cdr from magus was helpfull.
> Zac builds tank.
> Choath builds tank.
> Gragas builds tank.
> Nunu builds tank.
> You get the picture.


The reason this is more useful than lich bane is the fact its an AOE spellblade it was made to give stats while clearing camps. Clear times are better meaning something has to be sacrificed before #broken. Do you know how balance works?{{champion:84}} (works great on Akali jungle btw)

> [{quoted}](name=Saminus Maximus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=q8BsGNnz,comment-id=00020002,timestamp=2015-07-03T19:11:11.649+0000)
>
> The only ap jungler who likes ruinglaive is diana, and even then just giving magus some mana sustain would have been a better choice since lichbane beats out ruinglaive for damage.
> 
> Fiddle got completeyl fucked.
> Eve is better built ad.
> Elise doesn't matter what she builds she's still trash tier. And as a stun bot the cdr from magus was helpfull.
> Zac builds tank.
> Choath builds tank.
> Gragas builds tank.
> Nunu builds tank.
> You get the picture.

 Nay since diana and Evelyn can proc it and it turns their AAs and Evelyn ravage intoagical, allowing them to bypass armor and synergies with men more easily.

other champs never built magus due to going tank.

Evelyn was built ad due to ravage being physical and ad ratios being increased. This allows her to go ap assassin more easily than in the past.
Not even Nidalee and Diana want Runeglaive. They would take the superior AP and spellblade from Lich Bane any day than Runeglaive.

> [{quoted}](name=Elias1724,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=q8BsGNnz,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2015-07-03T19:07:16.047+0000)
>
> Not even Nidalee and Diana want Runeglaive. They would take the superior AP and spellblade from Lich Bane any day than Runeglaive.

I prefer Cinderhulk on Diana jungle mostly because it gives her more AoE clear with her W up. Runeglaive is garbage on everything that isn't Ezreal or Gangplank.

> [{quoted}](name=Elias1724,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=q8BsGNnz,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2015-07-03T19:07:16.047+0000)
>
> Not even Nidalee and Diana want Runeglaive. They would take the superior AP and spellblade from Lich Bane any day than Runeglaive.

Diana didn't go lichbane before runeglaive unless fed.
Are you kidding? Diana relies on auto attacks as part of her burst and your saying she never went Lich Bane. The only way I see that happening if you are playing tanky/bruiser Diana, not assassin.

as someone who plays diana jungle(and was diamond last season).. lich bane sucked... it was drastically worse than nashors tooth for diana jungle after trying multiple games each way... with nashors tooth, I was ending up 2-3 levels ahead of everyone on my team and the enemy team regularly (this was back in the magus days) and usually matching their cs even as a jungler (getting 200 cs over a 35 minute game was normal for me on diana jungle in the magus days with the 40% cdr.  I just had so much more gold and exp to spend on everything going the nashors tooth way.

Diana's spells do enough damage that flat-AP items are more cost-effective than a spellblade item like Lich Bane. It's more of an item you build late-game if you've already snowballed and don't need to build another defensive item outside of Hourglass.
But than what are mid laners gonne take we all know smite is for mid laners right

ap junglers need sustain/defense
they don't have great autoattacks like the warrior and devourer classes, nor the tankiness of cinderhulk (which also comes with a damage passive)

I say bring back spell vamp off of monsters or armor...maybe the vamp would help more
They could have the mana restore only proc from smacking jungle camps
That's already what happens...
I was not aware.
step 3: bring back magus and give it a mana regen scaling of magic damage like runeglaive.
it didn't help any junglers, and it's imbalanced in the hands of laners(NOT junglers like chulk was).  so no, you are completely wrong.  runeglaive was a terrible idea through and through.
and removing magus is even worse.
Amen

lets just remove all items.
TEAM WITH BIGGEST BASE DAMAGE WINS

Hrm.. not sure, I jungled as Fizz (Apishly) the other day and managed 10-2... it's fairly effective for most AP Junglers, or just laners that can benefit from AP and want to increase their farming potential early/mid game (I farmed like a boss with it on Ezreal one game, far better than any other setup I've tried)... HOWEVER, that being said!

It is fairly worthless late game because you replace it with a Lich Bane (or T-Force on those just using it to farm).  For some reason it's passive is Spell Blade, but it doesn't do the damage Spell Blade does, and it's a minor AOE proc.  AKA It's a different ability.  I say adjust the passive, or just change it's bloody name and drop it's ratio a tad and let it stack with the real Spell Blade items. That's the only issue I see.  Around mid game you exchange your jungle item for something that flat replaces it.  You lose your AOE, the AP, and your wave clearing ability, but you gain a Spell Blade that actually carries into the late game (or you have a vestigial AP item for 80 AP and the rest no longer matters).  Sooo That's my idea.
they're buffing the spell blade and the AP it grants.
If that's the case then it becomes valid again for late game, and my -only- issue with the item is gone.

{{champion:131}} is the only one thats good with it, and you still only proc it once per camp so its not a lot anyway. just bring magus back and give all jungle enchants extra mana regen vs monsters (because not only ap junglers need mana, there are tanks and peoople like {{champion:121}} who would appreciate some mana as well). boom fixed everything!
{{item:3070}} {{champion:72}} {{item:3070}} But...but.... **i **like runeglaive....

It's like they wanted to nerf Fiddle in the jungle...but rather than just outright nerfing him, they removed the one jungle item he uses and buffed a bunch of random champions in the process. I'm still not sure why they did this other than they thought it'd be a cool addition....addition....I'm so glad they didn't change Abyssal Scepter.
But then jungling might actually not be total shit.

IDk if I maybe missed something but this isn't something junglers want? i use this on jungle Akali and its super effective. E and hit big rapter after a single items and insta kill camp. I personally find this the most useful jungle tool. You just have to try it and stop calling it useless probs.{{champion:84}}
